content: Certainly! According to data from the Corporation for National and Community Service, the age group that tends to volunteer the most during disasters is the 30-49 age group. This group has consistently shown higher rates of volunteering during disasters as compared to other age groups over the past decade. However, it is worth noting that people of all ages and backgrounds can and do volunteer during disasters, and the specific levels of volunteering may vary depending on the nature and severity of the disaster, as well as other factors like the location and demographics of affected communities.
